titles.title: To extend indefinitely the authority of the States of Washington, Oregon, and California to manage a Dungeness crab fishery until the effective date of a fishery management plan for the fishery under the Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Fisheries Conservation, Wildlife and Oceans.
Subcommittee on Fisheries Conservation, Wildlife and Oceans Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 107-91.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 47.

action.text: Mr. Gilchrest moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1661.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

bill.summary: 6/6/2001--Passed House without amendment. Amends Federal law to eliminate the September 30, 2001, sunset provision respecting the authority of California, Oregon, and Washington to manage the Dungeness crab fisheries in their respective exclusive economic zones.
